![%BKMPK%9AQ% 36L92}7K7HT](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50103321/57192897-37811880-6f68-11e9-9e42-6d8e673484af.png)

I'm new to skywalking, can you tell where do I start?
That ref to #2560 . When your time in agent, oap and browser are not same, this happens. If you feel interests, could join that one
You need to learn plugin development. And add this as a optional feature to db plugin
Cluster management is for backend running in cluster mode. Load balance is not its design goal. Use envoy, nginx or other lb.

what you mean is when one node Downtime，other node still can provide services? but Each node can provide services regardless of whether the cluster is configured or not. so I want to known cluster‘s Effect。
No, that is load balance responsibilities, oap cluster management is for inside communication. Oap node needs to talk with each other.
Why close? Need a new one?

I rechecked the #2560 , this is just a UI bug. @TinyAllen 

This time should be formatted based on selected UTC time in query condition.

I and @peng-yongsheng deep dive on this yesterday. Turn out, we both misunderstand one API in Java. Timestamp(System.currentTimeMillis) is UTC-0 based, no time zone involved.

So, this issue should be closed, and become two separated things.
1. [BUG] #2586 UI bug, needs to be fixed. @TinyAllen 
1. [FEATURE] #2594 Backup supports setting time zone manually to override OS settings. cc @peng-yongsheng @hanahmily

@dsw1985815 could u provide a demo that can run directly

Spring Boot Actuator add `/trace`  as endpoints out of the box. 
I solved it by disable  `/trace`  endpoints. 
modify `webapp.yml` like this:

```yaml
server:
  port: 8080

collector:
  path: /graphql
  ribbon:
    ReadTimeout: 10000
    # Point to all backend's restHost:restPort, split by ,
    listOfServers: 127.0.0.1:12800

security:
  user:
    # username
    admin:
      # password
      password: admin

endpoints:
  trace:
   # disable  trace  endpoints
    enabled: false

```
why builds failed. @wu-sheng
Because we open appveyor today :). Let's wait appveyor set right, then merge this.

> Because we open appveyor today :). Let's wait appveyor set right, then merge this.

ok, thanks .

Ref doc https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/1.5.1.RELEASE/reference/htmlsingle/#production-ready-endpoints

@hanahmily Do you prefer to ask UI change path or disable the endpoints/trace?
@wu-sheng The third option: change the endpoints base path
`change the endpoints base path` in Spring? I think that is a better way. Could you submit a pull request to fix this?

Yes, see #2582 . Will be fixed and pull request is welcome.

Error is an API for agent. `ActiveSpan#tag` doesn't support to do that. 
If you want that, try to contribute
1. Add `ActiveSpan#error`in toolkit
1. Call `AbstractSpan#errorOccurred` in the toolkit activation.
I don't know you are from lizhi.fm. Now it makes sense why you know so much about SkyWalking.
Please use SkyWalking 6. For 5, this means you are updating from the old version. You need to delete all indexes in es and reboot all agents.

There is a buffer cache in agent, so, you need to make sure at least there is enough memory space for it. Or, you could set the buffer size smaller. 37M shouldn't trigger OOM.

I am not sure. I only could suggest checking pom.xml between yours and SkyWalking existing plugins.
Jar is copied based on pom.xml setting.

You could choose. This isn't requirement that you must support both. Is 1.0 plugin still ongoing?
Closing as no update in 20 days.

> Which version of `reactor-netty` does the user use? And I had checked that the latest [code](https://github.com/reactor/reactor-netty/blob/master/src/main/java/reactor/netty/http/server/HttpServerOperations.java) contains only one `status` method that the type of the first parameter is `HttpResponseStatus`.
> 
> Is that issue occur by the version the `webflux` plugin doesn't support?

This issue occurs in my local env with latest `reactor-netty` version.

I also checked the `reactor-netty` `0.7.x` and `0.8.x`. And i thought `java.lang.ClassCastException`  did not related with `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.spring.webflux.v5.StatusInterceptor`. So, i recked in the interceptor.

But, i found this method in `reactor.netty.http.server.HttpServerResponse#status(int)` through debug. So, I think, there is no need to recheck in the interceptor, I will delete it. :P
I think hbase should have official docker image and docker-compose. Does it?

It seems that the configuration of appveyor has some mistakes. In fact, I didn't find the config file appveyor.yml int root directory. 
Do we need to add the configuration?

There is no an offical image from apache,I found some image,but it  does not work well.
